sentences.sentence: Halloween is celebrated on October the 31st.
it originated from a pagan holiday and the Christian holiday of All-Saints’ Day.
Halloween is probably most famous in the U.S.A
some Christians are not so happy about Halloween.
Halloween has many easily identifiable symbols.
the colours orange and black are widely used.
one of the biggest Halloween activities is trick-or-treating.
children knock on doors and ask for a small gift.
food also plays a big part of Halloween.
toffee apples are very popular and so is anything made from pumpkin.
Halloween is also a popular topic for Hollywood.

info.title: scrambleJackLantern

info.subTitle: Halloween - Jack O'Lantern
info.quote: by Page McKean Zyromski, An AmericanCatholic.org Web Site from the Franciscans and Franciscan Media

sentences.sentence: according to legend, Jack grew up in a village in Ireland.
he earned a reputation for cleverness as well as laziness.
Jack first met the Devil at the local pub.
he challenged the Devil but he only snorted at such child’s play.
instantly, the Devil turned himself into a coin.
Jack held the coin in his hand which had a cross-shaped scar.
Jack figured he could repent later.
the agreed-upon day arrived and death took him by surprise.
St. Peter shook his head and could not let him in.
"Where can I go?" cried Jack. "How can I see in the darkness?"

sentences.sentence: 1. According to legend, Jack
sentences.answer: grew up in a village in Ireland.

sentences.sentence: 2. He earned a reputation for
sentences.answer: cleverness as well as laziness.

sentences.sentence: 3. Jack first met the Devil
sentences.answer: at the local pub.

sentences.sentence: 4. He challenged the Devil but he only
sentences.answer: snorted at such child’s play.

sentences.sentence: 5. Instantly, the devil turned
sentences.answer: himself into a coin.

sentences.sentence: 6. Jack held the coin in his hand
sentences.answer: which bore a cross-shaped scar.

sentences.sentence: 7. Jack figured he
sentences.answer: could repent later.

sentences.sentence: 8. But the agreed-upon day arrived
sentences.answer: and death took him by surprise.

sentences.sentence: 9. St. Peter shook his head and
sentences.answer: could not let him in.

sentences.sentence: 10. Where can I go?" cried Jack.
sentences.answer: "How can I see in the darkness?"

info.title: santeeSioux
info.headline: Theme
info.subTitle: Native Americans - The Santee Sioux and the Dakota wars of 1862.
info.quote: Source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sioux - Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

sentences.sentence: The Santee Sioux had given up most of their land
sentences.answer: and instead they received money from the United States.

sentences.sentence: By 1862, shortly after a failed crop the year before
sentences.answer: and a winter starvation, the yearly payment was late.

sentences.sentence: The local traders would not give
sentences.answer: the Santee Sioux credit to buy food.

sentences.sentence: One local trader went so far as to say,
sentences.answer: "If they're hungry, let them eat grass."

sentences.sentence: Dakota War began in 1862 when a few Santee men
sentences.answer: murdered a white farmer and most of his family.

sentences.sentence: 38 Santee men were hanged on December 26,
sentences.answer: 1862 in Mankato, Minnesota.

sentences.sentence: It was the largest mass-execution
sentences.answer: in U.S. history.

sentences.sentence: President Abraham Lincoln decided not to sentence 284 of
sentences.answer: the warriors and instead they were sent to prison.

sentences.sentence: The US then decided that they would stop giving
sentences.answer: the Indians their yearly payments for the next four years.

sentences.sentence: During and after the revolt, many Santee and their kin
sentences.answer: fled to Canada, or moved to other reservations.

The Jungle People must never hunt outside their grounds

info.title: jungleBookExcerptIII
info.headline: Text
info.subTitle: The Jungle Book(Excerpt) - Kipling, R. III

questions.question: Of course we carried our arms, not knowing ... we should meet with.
“They are the men from ... we have just escaped,” said I to Big Otter;
“For ... are these pretty things, my dear?” asked Mrs Liston.
Once upon a time in the old, old days there were two brothers, one of ... was rich and the other poor.
When his youngest son, ... he loved most of all, asked naturally what was to be his share, the father replied:
"I am sad at heart. My victory is no comfort to me, for to-day I have lost a friend ... I believed true."
The giant read: 'Seven at one stroke,' and thought that they had been men ... the tailor had killed,
There was once upon a time a queen to ... God had given no children.
There was a hole in the ground close beside them ... contained a small fire;
It is a frame-house, or cottage, ..., if not built according to the most approved rules of architecture, is at least neat, clean, comfortable-looking, and what one might style pretty.
Big Otter and I, rode slowly up the winding path ... led to this cottage.
I felt that there are some things ... some minds cannot understand;
Uncle Henry sat upon the doorstep and looked anxiously at the sky, ... was even grayer than usual.
"She is my aunt ... lives in Kansas, where I came from."
The Scarecrow, ... was never tired, stood up in another corner and waited patiently until morning came.
"I was born the son of a woodman ... chopped down trees in the forest and sold the wood for a living."
"That's all right," said the Stork, ... was flying along beside them.

sortable.title: Modals - Ability(can, could, be able to)

info.title: modalsAbilitySortable
info.headline: Grammar
info.subTitle: Modals - Ability(can, could, be able to)

sentences.sentence: Maria can play the piano.
sentences.answer: It sounds like she has been doing it for years.

sentences.sentence: I could read when I was four.
sentences.answer: Few kids can do that.

sentences.sentence: He couldn't swim at all until he took lessons.
sentences.answer: Now he can do it alone.

sentences.sentence: I will be able to fly a spaceship in 2 years.
sentences.answer: I am currently practising with a simulator.

sentences.sentence: I have been able to visit many countries in my life.
sentences.answer: Now that I am old I prefer to stay at home.

sentences.sentence: She won't be able to speak Italian in a week!
sentences.answer: It will take months.

sentences.sentence: He could have learned Chineese.
sentences.answer: He didn’t have time, however.

sentences.sentence: He couldn’t breathe very well.
sentences.answer: He should have stayed at home.

sentences.sentence: I will not be able to go to the party tonight.
sentences.answer: I have homework to do.

sentences.sentence: She can’t dance very well.
sentences.answer: It almost looks dangerous.

sortable.title: Modals - Possibility(must, might, could, should, may, can't)

info.title: modalsPossibilitySortable
info.headline: Grammar
info.subTitle: Modals - Possibility(must, might, could, should, may, can't)

sentences.sentence: They must be very rich.
sentences.answer: Look at the house.

sentences.sentence: They must be really good friends.
sentences.answer: They are always hanging out together.

sentences.sentence: They can't be at home.
sentences.answer: All the lights are turned off.

sentences.sentence: She will be at stadium by now.
sentences.answer: The competition is very important to her.

sentences.sentence: He should be there by now.
sentences.answer: He left over an hour ago.

sentences.sentence: He could be in his room.
sentences.answer: He usually does his homework at this hour.

sentences.sentence: They must have left early.
sentences.answer: If not they would have picked up the phone.

sentences.sentence: He might be away on holiday.
sentences.answer: At least he is not at the office.

sentences.sentence: She may not pass the exam.
sentences.answer: I'm sure she didn't study.

sentences.sentence: It can't be correct.
sentences.answer: This is too difficult for someone at that age..
